intro: Utricularia stricticaulis, commonly known as the narrow-stem bladderwort, is a carnivorous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Lentibulariaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and specialized bladder-like structures used for trapping prey. The plant typically grows in shallow, nutrient-poor waters, where it relies on its carnivorous adaptations to supplement its nutrient intake. Its stems are usually slender and erect, while its flowers are small and often white or purple in color. Utricularia stricticaulis is an important species in aquatic ecosystems, contributing to the control of small aquatic invertebrates.
